page.title: 15Yetholm Shepherds Show
page.content: This show, always held on the first Saturday in October has been a feature of life in the two villages and thier associated valleys for over 100 years and must be one of the longest running events of its kind in Scotland. Allowing for war time breaks the show has been cancelled twice, once due to foot and mouth disease and more recently in 1983 when Yetholm Haugh, the idtllic setting for such an event was flooded. Show afternoon includes the Sport features including the hill race and numerous flat races.An exhibition of Highland Dancing, a Haggis-hurling competition organised by local members of the Heart Foundation and quoit throwing are popular activities.Trophies are presented at 4.30pm, a duty carried out in 1984 by The Duchess of Roxburghe.
